title: Billie Piper wraps up a blue fur coat to as she resumes filming for phone hacking drama I Hate Suzie
text:
She's set to play a star on the wane in the Sky Atlantic drama I Hate Suzie.

And Billie Piper opted for an eclectic ensemble as she resumed filming for her latest dramatic role in East London on Wednesday.

The former Doctor Who star, 37, was wrapped up in a blue fur coat as she prepared to film the scenes as the titular character who is the victim of phone hacking.

Cosy: Billie Piper, 37, opted for an eclectic blue faux fur coat as she resumed filming the phone hacking drama I Hate Suzie in East London on Wednesday

Billie proudly displayed her character's quirky sense of style as she arrived on-set to film the dramatic scenes.

The acclaimed actress sported the blue fur coat with rainbow striped trousers that almost covered her matching black shoes.

As she chatted on her phone, Billie carried a patent black handbag in the crook of her arm with her blonde tresses pulled into a simple ponytail.

Relaxed: The former Doctor Who star teamed the colourful coat with rainbow striped trousers as she filmed scenes for Sky Atlantic drama, which is expected to air in 2020

Major role: Billie - who also co-created the series - plays a star on the wane whose phone is hacked, and photos of her in a 'compromising position' are leaked online

In the eight-part series Billie plays the titular character Suzie, a star on the wane who is shocked to learn that her phone has been hacked.

As a result of the hack photos of Suzie in a 'compromising position' are leaked online, and she is forced to deal with the explosive fallout.

Joining in the series' cast are Daniel Ings, Leila Farzad and Nathaniel Martello-White, with Lorraine Ashbourne and Phil Daniels playing her parents.

Billie will be serving as co-creator on the new project alongside Secret Diary of a Call Girl writer Lucy Prebble, while Georgi Banks-Davies will be directing.

Busy: She was joined on the set by a member of the film crew, who fixed her blonde tresses into a simple high ponytail in preparation for the scenes

Speaking of the show, Billie gushed: 'A strong, dark, fun tale like I Hate Suzie needs actors with nerve as well as talent.

'We’re thrilled to be working with such a brilliant ensemble. We hope you enjoy!' she concluded.

Meanwhile, Billie recently made her directorial debut in Rare Beasts, in which she plays Mandy - a modern woman raising a son in the midst of a female revolution, mining the pain of her parents separation and professionally writing about a love that no longer exists.

The Secret Diary Of A Call Girl actress has two sons, Winston, 10 and Eugene, seven, with ex-husband Laurence Fox.

She welcomed her first daughter, Tallulah, with boyfriend Johnny Lloyd in January.

I Hate Suzie is expected to air on Sky Atlantic in 2020.
